narrative.title: 1Re Division Fran Aise Libre - 1942Q2
narrative.situation: French Infantry Division (Free French Forces) deployed in North Africa during 1942Q2.
narrative.objectives: Static defensive operations anchoring southern flank of Eighth Army Gazala Line. Pivot point for Allied maneuver in Libyan Desert. Defended fortified position (Bir Hakeim) with extensive minefield network.
narrative.axis_objective: Hold current positions and prevent Allied breakthrough.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and neutralize Axis defensive positions.

weather.terrain: Barren desert plain (rocky/sandy soil), completely flat with minimal vegetation

air_support.note: No theater air summary available for this quarter

special_rules: Desert warfare experience from previous operations in Libya, Eritrea, Syria, Gabon
Expertise in defensive fortification and minefield construction
Multi-national colonial composition (French, Foreign Legion, North African, Equatorial African, Pacific Islander)
Integration with British Eighth Army command structure
Night breakout operations and infiltration tactics

environment.terrain_type: Barren desert plain (rocky/sandy soil), completely flat with minimal vegetation
